page.title: 15RECREATION IN GRIN'TON AREA
page.content: The three centres(Grin'ton,W.Bradford and Ch'burn)have playing fields and children's playground.All have football teams,2 have cricket teams and 1 has a tennis court which sometimes supports a netball team,and a local school plays rugby.All have annual athletic sports days.There are cubs,scouts,brownies and guide groups,as well as 3 youth clubs,2 play groups and mother and toddler groups.There is a drama group,yoga and keep fit classes,gardening association,camera club and 2 women's institute groups.The 5 public houses mostly have dart teams as well as billiards or pool and dominoes.The Ribble is fished by 4 local clubs and a long distance footpath passes along its banks.One often sees joggers,cyclists and sometimes a pony and trap.Occasional social gatherings are held,eg.whist drives and dances.
